Description: Body fragment of North Ionian black-figured pottery closed vase, oenochoe or amphora. Inside reserved. Outside, above, recumbent goat, its hind part preserved; added red on haunch and belly; below, banding in black, dilute and red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit: 'May be by the same hand as Reading 26.ii.52 (CVA Great Britain 12: pl.22 fig.22) from Naukratis.'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 10, no. 24 pl. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.907)
